Subsets and Proper Subsets

Term

subset âŠ†
All of the elements of one set is contained in or is equal to another set

All of the elements of one set is container in another set that are not equal

not a subset of âŠ„

Logic
Definitions








Term
Definition
Example




Union âˆª
A âˆª B = {x | x âˆˆ A or x âˆˆ B}
Elements that are in either set A or set B
A = {1, 2, 3}, B = {3, 4, 5}
A âˆª B = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5}


Intersection âˆ©
A âˆ© B = {x | x âˆˆ A or x âˆˆ B}
Elements that are in both set A and set B
A = {1, 2, 3}, B = {3, 4, 5}
A âˆ© B = {3}


Difference -
A - B = {x | x âˆˆ A or x âˆ‰ B}
Elements of A that are not in B
A = {1, 2, 3}, B = {3, 4, 5}
A - B = {1, 2}


Compliment â€™
Aâ€™ = Ä€ = {x | x âˆˆ U and x âˆ‰ A}
All elements that are not in A
A = {1, 2, 3}
Aâ€™ = {4, 5, 6, 7â€¦}


Symmetric Difference âŠ•
A âŠ• B = (A - B) âˆª (B - A)
All elements of A or B, excluding the elements that are in both A and B
A = {1, 2, 3}, B = {3, 4, 5}
A âŠ• B = {1, 2, 4, 5}




* if there are no intersection for Symmetric Difference, then it is known as disjointed
